Furthermore, the game is quite badly optimized, running the game at 4k ultra settings I was getting 20-30 fps compared to well over 60 and above on the OG. There are loads of graphic enhancing mods for Mafia II that are way better looking than this remaster. I would only recommend this game to the people who already have the OG Mafia II and are able to play this for free, but I wouldn't bother buying for those who don't have this game.

They could at least added some cut content :(

title: Mafia II Definitive Edition
review:
I was very hopeful this remaster would be much more than just a simple graphical touch-up. This has been very disappointing and so many opportunities were missed.

Pros:
- The good looks great in some areas; Textures and models have been improved, but you're really only gonna notice this with some walls on buildings and the character head models.
- Weapon sound effects have been completely changed (Some of them sound ok while others sound unfitting)
- The infamous game-breaking black polygon bug has been fixed
- Performance is enhanced
- Many songs that got removed from past updates have been restored

Cons:
- This "remaster" does way too little. Besides the DLCs, no additional content is added
- None of the features that were cut from the original 2010 game has been added. This was a huge missed opportunity
- APEX cloth physics are disabled despite the files being present
- The file size is WAY too damn big. (How did it go from 8 GB's to 37 GB's?)
- The emotion and intensity of some of the character ingame voices has been heavily toned down. (The soldier who tells Vito to "Take the Shot" says it with far less urgency and is much more quiet)

Despite the good changes made, I cannot even call this a remaster. This is more or less a port that has been enhanced at a bare minimum. Take 2 and Hangar 13 took a very lazy route with this trilogy pack. They could have truly made Mafia 2 into what it was originally meant to be. Instead, what we are given is nothing but a quick cash grab. 

No additional cutscenes or story, not scrapped content restored, no new features. Its just plain old Mafia 2, that is in some ways even worse than the original.

You might as well stick with the original game. There really is nothing from this remaster that you will miss.

title: Mafia II Definitive Edition
review: Don't get me wrong, Mafia 2 is a great game. This remaster does look a fair amount better than the original that is 10 years old. However, within the first 10 minutes of playing i have experienced npc's getting stuck and falling through the floor and faces not loading causing npc's to look like zombies. This game is 10 years old so it is understandable that it will feel a bit dated, but why not fix a few of the bugs while upping the resolution? You can slap on a new coat of paint on a car, but if it doesn't run well then what's the point? This is basically a re-release and just isn't worth $30. I would wait for a sale, maybe around $15 before i would recommend this to someone. I still love Mafia 2, but they could have done more with this remaster.

title: Mafia II Definitive Edition
review:
Mafia II: Definitive Edition is FREE to all existing owners of the original game and includes all the DLC content, It is not a 'remaster' and it's certainly not a remake either so expectations must be kept in check. This was more of a release for the current gen consoles than anything. 

Improvements are minimal but still noticeable - the visuals have more detail in places and are much sharper too along with increased draw distances. The performance is incredibly smooth and the game-breaking bug that plagued high framerate monitors has also been addressed. 

At full price for newcomers, it may seem quite expensive but this still remains one of the most remarkable games ever created with an unforgettable cast of characters and incredible story set in a truly wonderful world. You also get the Classic version thrown in for good measure!
